net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.music

Enum TonePitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TonePitch>
      • net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.music.TonePitch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<TonePitch>, AttributeReadValue<String>, Datatype, SimpleDatatype<String>

    public enum TonePitch
extends Enum<TonePitch>
implements SimpleDatatype<String>
    This enum represents the TonePitch of a musical note. It is based on the twelve tone music system and only represents a single octave instead of an absolute pitch value.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      A semitone (half step) higher than the pitch C.

      G

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • C

        public static final TonePitch C
        The base tone of the common MusicalKey.C_MAJOR key.

      • CIS

        public static final TonePitch CIS
        A semitone (half step) higher than the pitch C. The enharmonic change of this pitch is des (d♭).

      • D

        public static final TonePitch D
        Two semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.

      • DIS

        public static final TonePitch DIS
        Three semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. The enharmonic change of this pitch is es (e♭).

      • E

        public static final TonePitch E
        Four semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. The enharmonic change of this pitch is fes (f♭).

      • F

        public static final TonePitch F
        Five semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. The enharmonic change of this pitch is eis (e♯).

      • FIS

        public static final TonePitch FIS
        Six semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. The enharmonic change of this pitch is ges (g♭).

      • G

        public static final TonePitch G
        Seven semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.

      • GIS

        public static final TonePitch GIS
        Eight semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. The enharmonic change of this pitch is as (a♭).

      • A

        public static final TonePitch A
        Nine semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. The middle a (a1, Concert A reference) is normalized to 440Hz.

      • B_FLAT

        public static final TonePitch B_FLAT
        Ten semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. In most countries this pitch is simply called B. See B_NATURAL for further details.

      • B_NATURAL

        public static final TonePitch B_NATURAL
        Eleven semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. The enharmonic change of this pitch is ces (c♭). In most countries this pitch is simply called H. However the Americans use B instead of H what can cause confusion with B_FLAT. The international notation therefore suggests the following notation:
        International American European
        B♮ B H
        B♭ B♭ B

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the official String representation of this Datatype. While the general contract of Object.toString() is very weak and mainly used for debugging, the contract here is very strong. The returned String has to be suitable for end-users and official output to any kind of sink.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is not supposed to do internationalization (I18N). See NlsMessage for this purpose and implement NlsObject if you want to support I18N/L10N.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Datatype
        Overrides:
        toString in class Enum<TonePitch>
        Returns:
        the official String representation to display the value of this Datatype.

      • fromValue

        public static TonePitch fromValue(String value)
        This method gets the TonePitch for the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value of the requested TonePitch .
        Returns:
        the requested TonePitch or null if no such TonePitch exists.

      • transpose

        public TonePitch transpose(int semitoneSteps)
        This method transposes this TonePitch by the given number of semitoneSteps. The TonePitch will wrap so transpose(12) will return the TonePitch itself (this) just like transpose(0) or e.g. transpose(-24).
        Parameters:
        semitoneSteps - is the number of semitone steps to transpose. A positive value transposes towards a higher pitch, a negative value transposes towards a lower pitch. A value of zero (0) will have no change.
        Returns:
        the transposed TonePitch.
